content.question: A proton is placed at rest in a uniform electric field. When the proton is released, it accelerates through a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, acquiring a speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a result. Next, an alpha particle is released from rest in the field and accelerates through the same distance. The speed acquired by the alpha particle is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction v over the square root of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi><mo>/</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="the square root of 2 times v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt><mi>v</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction v over the square root of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi><mo>/</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
